title.rendered: Find Rooms For Rent in Columbia Street Waterfront District

content.rendered:
Columbia Street Waterfront District (CSWD) is perhaps the smallest district in the Brooklyn borough. Despite its name, the 22 block neighborhood has no direct access to the waterfront. Rather, it is sandwiched between two expressways: the Brooklyn-Queen Expressway and the Brooklyn-Battery Tunnel. The once-bustling center of South Brooklyn now harbors newly converted residential buildings with several exquisite eateries, trendy stores, and poultry markets.

Want to know what to expect when searching for a room to rent in the Columbia Street Waterfront District? Let’s get right to it.

Where is Columbia Street Waterfront District?

You’ll find Columbia Street Waterfront District between Cobble Hill, Carroll Gardens, and Red Hook. It is located along the Upper New York Bay waterfront to the west of the Brooklyn-Queens Expressway. In fact, this is why it used to be called West of the Trench. Keep reading to find out about what living in Columbia Street Waterfront District is like, and the average rent in the area.

Related: Find Rooms For Rent in Carroll Gardens, Brooklyn

Find rooms for rent in Columbia Street Waterfront District

Find Rooms For Rent In Columbia Street Waterfront District

Apartments in Columbia Street Waterfront District are among the most expensive in the borough. This may be because there are not so many houses available here, so demand shoots up the median price. Nonetheless, you can find good deals if you are looking for a room to rent in Columbia Street Waterfront District, so don’t go looking elsewhere just yet!

Average rent in Columbia Street Waterfront District

Is Columbia Street Waterfront District safe?

Safety is always a top concern for anyone looking to move to a new neighborhood. So if you’ve asked yourself, ‘Is Columbia Street Waterfront District safe?’ you’ll be glad to hear it is one of the safest neighborhoods in the Brooklyn borough. Also, the crime rate is below the national average.

Access to information can be the difference between safety and danger. Further, if you are looking to find a room to rent in Columbia Street Waterfront District, these apps help you stay even safer, through access to the latest information about the enclave in real-time.

  1. NextDoor: This private social network helps keep you up to date with what is happening in your neighborhood.
  2. AreaVibes: Depending on your Zip code, AreaVibes assigns livability scores to neighborhoods. The scores are assigned based on available amenities, prevailing cost of living, rate of crime, employment rate, schools, housing and user ratings.
  3. Hotline Number: By dialing 911, you can get help on any emergencies that may arise while you are in the neighborhood.

Public Transit in Columbia Street Waterfront District

Walkability

With its cobbled pavements and smooth walkways, CSWD scores high on the walkability index.

Roads & traffic

Because it is sandwiched between two expressways, this is a great location for those who commute by car. The roads are, however, made busy by the cargo facility in Red Hook – meaning a lot of trucks ply the roads.

Nearby train stations

The closest train station to this neighborhood is the Carroll Street Station, about a mile away in Carroll Gardens. In addition, only the F and G trains are available.

Restaurants in Columbia Street Waterfront District

1. Mazzat

Although usually quiet in the day, Mazzat can get very busy at night. Take a seat on the restaurant’s patio, where you can eat and enjoy the beautiful sight of downtown Columbia Street.

Order Takeout

2. KROK Brooklyn

Of the restaurants in Columbia Street Waterfront District, KROK is new and trending. This Thai restaurant has taken the neighborhood by storm since Pok Pok closed down. The recipes are built around papaya salads, fried wings, and meat skewers, beer-fermented shrimp, and delicious sticky rice.

Get Directions

3. The Longshoreman

One of the best restaurants in Columbia Street Waterfront District is the Longshoreman. It is a good place to unwind after a hard day’s work. In fact, an eatery with history, this restaurant serves the best Italian recipes around. The freshness of the carbs will leave you asking for more.

Contact now

Related: Things You Can Do In Brooklyn

Parks in Columbia Street Waterfront District

CSWD has six community parks. That’s way more than any other enclave around. Together, four of the parks are collectively known as the Columbia Waterfront Garden. The three most popular ones are highlighted below.

1. The Human Compass Garden

Artistic excellence and aesthetic magnificence characterize this community garden. Moreover, it is a common center for art exhibitions and totally worth considering when you are looking for a room for rent in Columbia Street Waterfront District.

2. Summit Street Community Garden

Magic and peace. These are the core values of those who keep this garden, and you’ll go away feeling them after a visit here.

3. The Amazing Garden

At an elevation of up to 20 feet, this community-tended green oasis truly is amazing and worth considering when you are looking for rooms to rent in Columbia Street Waterfront District.

D’you know what else Roomi does outside of helping its readers find rooms for rent in Columbia Street, Waterfront District? With our ever-increasing lists of rooms and roommates across the world, we help you find your perfect match!

DOWNLOAD THE APP NOW!
